document_data.name: ''Cloak of the High Forest''
document_data.mainbody:
The '''''Cloak of the High Forest''''' was a type of [[magic]]al cloak that was seemingly created by nature itself, within the [[High Forest]] of [[Northwest Faerûn]]. Once created, it would present itself to [[druid]]s in times of reflection and need.

The uncovering of the cloak seemed to present a message to the wearer: they could appreciate the rain while still seeking shelter from it".
document_data.Powers: The cloak offered its wearer similar defenses to a ''[[cloak of protection]]''.
document_data.History:
One of these cloaks was discovered by the [[shapeshifter (kit)|shapeshifting]] [[druid]] [[Cernd]], when he spent a year traveling through [[Faerûn]] meditating upon his role in the grand balance of nature. Shortly before the cold season set in, Cernd found the cloak within the High Forest. His cloak appeared to have been woven from the undergrowth of the forest.

Yet another ''cloak of the High Forest'' was discovered by the future [[Great Druid]] [[Jasswin]], when he spent a season never living under shelter in an attempt to "feel the land unhindered". Prior to the cold season of that particular year, the wind blew the cloak to him.
